context: What differences are there between the Wii version and other consoles? Is the Wii version "stripped back"?
response: you get the same things... just they hook up to the console so you need the right one to hook up to the machine. the infinity needs a controller and a nun chuck.... I don't know what you need for other consoles.

context: How loud of sound do the keys on the keyboard make when typing? Does it give off a loud "click clacky" sound when typing?
response: I have never thought about this before.  It is kind of loud but it's not the loudest keyboard I have ever owned.  It is probably not the type of keyboard you want if someone is sleeping next to you but it is not loud enough to disrupt my concentration.

context: Is this game compatiable with Windows 8.1 64 bit edition ?
response: Yes, I just installed it on Windows 8.1 64-bit.  Just remember to manually navigate to the installation directory to find the executables for your games, which you can create shortcuts for.

context: does the game work with Windows 8.1?
response: We have't tried 8.1 but it does work with 8.0.

context: if it's good quality, they say that the charger  doesn't last much
response: I've had mine for a while no problems so far the unit is well constructed maybe they got a bad unit which can happen

context: What format is this game in? And is it compatible with PAL/Australia? :)
response: This version of the game is in English, and the PS3 isn't region-locked, so don't worry, you can play it wherever you live. ^_^
I use it for various sims with no problem.  Can't imagine it wouldn't work with F1 2014

context: Does this work with in steam Europe?
response: I had to do something with windows to get it to work. Can't remember what exactly. As for Europe i m guessing it shouldn't make a difference.

context: Does this edition come with the Angel Wings for your character?
response: It does have exclusive items....no wings though, read descriptions people

context: does it have a circular octagonal or square gate ? the ps3 version of it has both circular gate and octagonal gate too.  does this bring both ?
response: It comes with square gate installed and the circular and octagonal gates in the box.

context: Can it work on the Atari 2600?
response: yes , i can play my atari 2600 with it no problems, had to hook it up to my vcd,

context: What's the length of the cord?
response: The cord is 6 feet but with the mouse and USB its about 6 1/3 feet

context: does this support the Logitech G27 Racing Wheel?
response: i´m not sure if this game support any racing wheels because if not a driving simulator man, i play this game with pad controller and respond very good... greetings.

context: Will this product work with a Motorola DCX3200-M HD cable box provided by Charter?
response: I am using the splitter to split HDMI from the output of my video/receiver to 2 flat panel screens.    that works just fine.   I would assume that your intended use on a charter hdmi output should work equally well.

context: What age is this game best suitable for? I have a 5 and 4yr old and was wondering if this is a game they could play.
response: My 5 yr old plays this game the most in our family.  Sometimes, he gets frustrated and asks for help, but he handles most of it on his own.  We own most of the other Lego games, so he knows how to navigate the games pretty well.

context: Does anybody know if this adapter works for the Turbografx game system?
response: Yes it does that adapter works better then the original one

context: Can you use Giants on the new SwapForce portal?
response: You can use the figures, but you have to buy the new game for your sister. All the characters are forward compatible.

context: Does this game require Origin to be played?
response: I don't remember, but it is on my steam , through add non game to library
